presets.title: Most Called Queries
presets.description: Shows top 10 most frequently called queries with execution time and I/O stats
presets.sql:
SELECT
  query,
  (interval '1 millisecond' * total_exec_time)::text AS total_exec_time,
  to_char((total_exec_time/sum(total_exec_time) OVER()) * 100, 'FM90D0') || '%' AS prop_exec_time,
  to_char(calls, 'FM999G999G990') AS ncalls,
  (interval '1 millisecond' * (blk_read_time + blk_write_time))::text AS sync_io_time
FROM
  pg_stat_statements
ORDER BY
  calls DESC
LIMIT 10

presets.title: Exclusive Locks
presets.description: Shows queries holding exclusive locks and their duration
presets.sql:
SELECT
  pg_stat_activity.pid,
  COALESCE(pg_class.relname, 'null') AS relname,
  COALESCE(pg_locks.transactionid::text, 'null') AS transactionid,
  pg_locks.granted,
  pg_stat_activity.query,
  age(now(), pg_stat_activity.query_start)::text AS age
FROM
  pg_stat_activity,
  pg_locks
  LEFT OUTER JOIN pg_class ON (pg_locks.relation = pg_class.oid)
WHERE
  pg_stat_activity.query <> '<insufficient privilege>'
  AND pg_locks.pid = pg_stat_activity.pid
  AND pg_locks.mode = 'ExclusiveLock'
ORDER BY
  query_start

presets.title: Cache Hit Rates
presets.description: Shows cache hit rates for indexes and tables
presets.sql:
SELECT
  'index hit rate' AS name,
  (sum(idx_blks_hit)) / nullif(sum(idx_blks_hit + idx_blks_read), 0) AS ratio
FROM
  pg_statio_user_indexes
UNION ALL
SELECT
  'table hit rate' AS name,
  sum(heap_blks_hit) / nullif(sum(heap_blks_hit) + sum(heap_blks_read), 0) AS ratio
FROM
  pg_statio_user_tables

presets.title: Blocking Queries
presets.description: Shows queries that are blocking other queries
presets.sql:
SELECT
  bl.pid AS blocked_pid,
  ka.query AS blocking_statement,
  age(now(), ka.query_start)::text AS blocking_duration,
  kl.pid AS blocking_pid,
  a.query AS blocked_statement,
  age(now(), a.query_start)::text AS blocked_duration
FROM
  pg_catalog.pg_locks bl
  JOIN pg_catalog.pg_stat_activity a ON bl.pid = a.pid
  JOIN pg_catalog.pg_locks kl
  JOIN pg_catalog.pg_stat_activity ka ON kl.pid = ka.pid
    ON bl.transactionid = kl.transactionid
    AND bl.pid != kl.pid
WHERE
  NOT bl.granted

presets.title: Index Usage Stats
presets.description: Shows how often indexes are used for each table
presets.sql:
SELECT
  schemaname || '.' || relname AS name,
  CASE
    WHEN idx_scan IS NULL THEN 'Insufficient data'
    WHEN idx_scan = 0 THEN 'Insufficient data'
    ELSE ROUND(100.0 * idx_scan / (seq_scan + idx_scan), 1) || '%'
  END percent_of_times_index_used,
  n_live_tup rows_in_table
FROM
  pg_stat_user_tables
WHERE
  NOT schemaname LIKE ANY(ARRAY['pg_catalog', 'information_schema'])
ORDER BY
  CASE
    WHEN idx_scan is null THEN 1
    WHEN idx_scan = 0 THEN 1
    ELSE 0
  END,
  n_live_tup DESC

presets.title: Unused Indexes
presets.description: Shows potentially unused indexes that might be candidates for removal
presets.sql:
SELECT
  schemaname || '.' || relname AS table,
  indexrelname AS index,
  pg_size_pretty(pg_relation_size(i.indexrelid)) AS index_size,
  idx_scan as index_scans
FROM
  pg_stat_user_indexes ui
  JOIN pg_index i ON ui.indexrelid = i.indexrelid
WHERE
  NOT indisunique
  AND idx_scan < 50
  AND pg_relation_size(relid) > 5 * 8192
  AND NOT schemaname LIKE ANY(ARRAY['pg_catalog', 'information_schema'])
ORDER BY
  pg_relation_size(i.indexrelid) / nullif(idx_scan, 0) DESC NULLS FIRST,
  pg_relation_size(i.indexrelid) DESC

presets.title: Role Connections
presets.description: Shows active connections per role and their limits
presets.sql:
SELECT
  rolname,
  (SELECT count(*)
   FROM pg_stat_activity
   WHERE pg_roles.rolname = pg_stat_activity.usename) AS active_connections,
  CASE
    WHEN rolconnlimit = -1 THEN current_setting('max_connections')::int8
    ELSE rolconnlimit
  END AS connection_limit
FROM
  pg_roles
ORDER BY
  2 DESC

presets.title: Table and Index Bloat
presets.description: Shows tables and indexes with potential bloat
presets.sql:
WITH constants AS (
  SELECT
    current_setting('block_size')::numeric AS bs,
    23 AS hdr,
    4 AS ma
),
bloat_info AS (
  SELECT
    ma,
    bs,
    schemaname,
    tablename,
    (datawidth + (hdr + ma - (
      CASE
        WHEN hdr % ma = 0 THEN ma
        ELSE hdr % ma
      END
    )))::numeric AS datahdr,
    (maxfracsum * (nullhdr + ma - (
      CASE
        WHEN nullhdr % ma = 0 THEN ma
        ELSE nullhdr % ma
      END
    ))) AS nullhdr2
  FROM (
    SELECT
      schemaname,
      tablename,
      hdr,
      ma,
      bs,
      SUM((1 - null_frac) * avg_width) AS datawidth,
      MAX(null_frac) AS maxfracsum,
      hdr + (
        SELECT 1 + count(*) / 8
        FROM pg_stats s2
        WHERE null_frac <> 0
          AND s2.schemaname = s.schemaname
          AND s2.tablename = s.tablename
      ) AS nullhdr
    FROM
      pg_stats s,
      constants
    GROUP BY
      1, 2, 3, 4, 5
  ) AS foo
),
table_bloat AS (
  SELECT
    schemaname,
    tablename,
    cc.relpages,
    bs,
    CEIL((cc.reltuples * (
      (datahdr + ma - (
        CASE
          WHEN datahdr % ma = 0 THEN ma
          ELSE datahdr % ma
        END
      )) + nullhdr2 + 4
    )) / (bs - 20::float)) AS otta
  FROM
    bloat_info
    JOIN pg_class cc ON cc.relname = bloat_info.tablename
    JOIN pg_namespace nn ON cc.relnamespace = nn.oid
      AND nn.nspname = bloat_info.schemaname
      AND nn.nspname <> 'information_schema'
),
index_bloat AS (
  SELECT
    schemaname,
    tablename,
    bs,
    COALESCE(c2.relname, '?') AS iname,
    COALESCE(c2.reltuples, 0) AS ituples,
    COALESCE(c2.relpages, 0) AS ipages,
    COALESCE(
      CEIL((c2.reltuples * (datahdr - 12)) / (bs - 20::float)),
      0
    ) AS iotta
  FROM
    bloat_info
    JOIN pg_class cc ON cc.relname = bloat_info.tablename
    JOIN pg_namespace nn ON cc.relnamespace = nn.oid
      AND nn.nspname = bloat_info.schemaname
      AND nn.nspname <> 'information_schema'
    JOIN pg_index i ON indrelid = cc.oid
    JOIN pg_class c2 ON c2.oid = i.indexrelid
)
SELECT
  schemaname || '.' || tablename AS table,
  pg_size_pretty(
    bs * relpages::bigint
  ) AS table_size,
  pg_size_pretty(
    bs * relpages::bigint - bs * otta::bigint
  ) AS bloat_size,
  round(
    100 * (relpages::float - otta) / relpages,
    1
  ) AS table_waste
FROM
  table_bloat
WHERE
  round(
    100 * (relpages::float - otta) / relpages,
    1
  ) >= 50
  AND bs * relpages >= 1024 * 1024
ORDER BY
  table_waste DESC;

presets.title: Query Outliers
presets.description: Shows queries that have taken the most time to execute
presets.sql:
SELECT
  (interval '1 millisecond' * total_exec_time)::text AS total_exec_time,
  to_char((total_exec_time/sum(total_exec_time) OVER()) * 100, 'FM90D0') || '%' AS prop_exec_time,
  to_char(calls, 'FM999G999G999G990') AS ncalls,
  (interval '1 millisecond' * (blk_read_time + blk_write_time))::text AS sync_io_time,
  query
FROM
  pg_stat_statements
WHERE
  userid = (SELECT usesysid FROM pg_user WHERE usename = current_user LIMIT 1)
ORDER BY
  total_exec_time DESC
LIMIT 10

presets.title: Index Sizes
presets.description: Shows the size of all indexes in the database
presets.sql:
SELECT
  n.nspname || '.' || c.relname AS name,
  pg_size_pretty(sum(c.relpages::bigint*8192)::bigint) AS size
FROM
  pg_class c
  LEFT JOIN pg_namespace n ON (n.oid = c.relnamespace)
WHERE
  NOT n.nspname LIKE ANY(ARRAY['pg_catalog', 'information_schema'])
  AND c.relkind = 'i'
GROUP BY
  n.nspname, c.relname
ORDER BY
  sum(c.relpages) DESC

presets.title: Table Record Counts
presets.description: Shows estimated record counts for all tables
presets.sql:
SELECT
  schemaname AS schema,
  relname AS name,
  n_live_tup AS estimated_count
FROM
  pg_stat_user_tables
WHERE
  NOT schemaname LIKE ANY(ARRAY['pg_catalog', 'information_schema'])
ORDER BY
  n_live_tup DESC

presets.title: Replication Slots
presets.description: Shows information about replication slots and their lag
presets.sql:
SELECT
  s.slot_name,
  s.active,
  COALESCE(r.state, 'N/A') as state,
  CASE
    WHEN r.client_addr IS NULL THEN 'N/A'
    ELSE r.client_addr::text
  END replication_client_address,
  GREATEST(0, ROUND((redo_lsn-restart_lsn)/1024/1024/1024, 2)) as replication_lag_gb
FROM
  pg_control_checkpoint(),
  pg_replication_slots s
  LEFT JOIN pg_stat_replication r ON (r.pid = s.active_pid)

presets.title: Total Table Sizes
presets.description: Shows the total size of tables including indexes and toast data
presets.sql:
SELECT
  n.nspname AS schema,
  c.relname AS name,
  pg_size_pretty(pg_total_relation_size(c.oid)) AS size
FROM
  pg_class c
  LEFT JOIN pg_namespace n ON (n.oid = c.relnamespace)
WHERE
  NOT n.nspname LIKE ANY(ARRAY['pg_catalog', 'information_schema'])
  AND c.relkind = 'r'
ORDER BY
  pg_total_relation_size(c.oid) DESC

presets.title: Sequential Scans
presets.description: Shows tables that are being sequentially scanned (potential missing indexes)
presets.sql:
SELECT
  schemaname || '.' || relname AS name,
  seq_scan as count
FROM
  pg_stat_user_tables
WHERE
  NOT schemaname LIKE ANY(ARRAY['pg_catalog', 'information_schema'])
ORDER BY
  seq_scan DESC

presets.title: Role Configurations
presets.description: Shows custom configurations set for database roles
presets.sql:
SELECT
  rolname as role_name,
  array_to_string(rolconfig, ',', '*') as custom_config
FROM
  pg_roles
WHERE
  rolconfig is not null

presets.title: Long Running Queries
presets.description: Shows currently running queries that have been running for a long time
presets.sql:
SELECT
  pid,
  age(clock_timestamp(), query_start) AS duration,
  query
FROM
  pg_stat_activity
WHERE
  query != '<IDLE>'
  AND query NOT ILIKE '%pg_stat_activity%'
  AND state != 'idle'
  AND state = 'active'
ORDER BY
  duration DESC

schema.title: Schema: tables
schema.description: Shows CREATE TABLE statements for all tables in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE TABLE ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(c.relname) || ' (
' ||
    array_to_string(
        array_agg(
            '    ' || quote_ident(a.attname) || ' ' ||
            pg_catalog.format_type(a.atttypid, a.atttypmod) ||
            CASE
                WHEN a.attnotnull THEN ' NOT NULL'
                ELSE ''
            END ||
            CASE
                WHEN a.atthasdef THEN ' DEFAULT ' || pg_get_expr(d.adbin, d.adrelid)
                ELSE ''
            END
        ),
        ',
'
    ) ||
    '
);' AS create_table
FROM
    pg_class c
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
    JOIN pg_attribute a ON c.oid = a.attrelid
    LEFT JOIN pg_attrdef d ON (a.attrelid, a.attnum) = (d.adrelid, d.adnum)
WHERE
    c.relkind = 'r'
    AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
    AND a.attnum > 0
    AND NOT a.attisdropped
GROUP BY
    n.nspname, c.relname
ORDER BY
    n.nspname, c.relname;

schema.title: Schema: functions
schema.description: Shows CREATE FUNCTION statements for all functions in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
  pg_get_functiondef(p.oid) as create_function
FROM
  pg_proc p
  JOIN pg_namespace n ON p.pronamespace = n.oid
WHERE
  n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
  AND p.prokind = 'f'
ORDER BY
  n.nspname, p.proname;

schema.title: Schema: procedures
schema.description: Shows CREATE PROCEDURE statements for all procedures in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
  pg_get_functiondef(p.oid) as create_procedure
FROM
  pg_proc p
  JOIN pg_namespace n ON p.pronamespace = n.oid
WHERE
  n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
  AND p.prokind = 'p'
ORDER BY
  n.nspname, p.proname;

schema.title: Schema: aggregates
schema.description: Shows CREATE AGGREGATE statements for all aggregates in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
  'CREATE AGGREGATE ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p.proname) ||
  '(' ||
  CASE
    WHEN p.proargtypes[0] = 0 THEN '*'
    ELSE pg_get_function_arguments(p.oid)
  END || ') (
' ||
  '  SFUNC = ' || quote_ident(n2.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p2.proname) || ',
' ||
  '  STYPE = ' || format_type(p.prorettype, null) ||
  CASE
    WHEN p.proaggtransfn::text <> '-'::text THEN ',
  FINALFUNC = ' || quote_ident(n3.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p3.proname)
    ELSE ''
  END || '
);' AS create_aggregate
FROM
  pg_proc p
  JOIN pg_namespace n ON p.pronamespace = n.oid
  JOIN pg_proc p2 ON p.proaggtransfn = p2.oid
  JOIN pg_namespace n2 ON p2.pronamespace = n2.oid
  LEFT JOIN pg_proc p3 ON p.proaggfinalfn = p3.oid
  LEFT JOIN pg_namespace n3 ON p3.pronamespace = n3.oid
WHERE
  n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
  AND p.prokind = 'a'
ORDER BY
  n.nspname, p.proname;

schema.title: Schema: casts
schema.description: Shows CREATE CAST statements for all casts in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
  'CREATE CAST (' || format_type(castsource, NULL) ||
  ' AS ' || format_type(casttarget, NULL) || ')
' ||
  CASE castmethod
    WHEN 'f' THEN '  WITH FUNCTION ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p.proname) || '(' || pg_get_function_arguments(p.oid) || ')
'
    WHEN 'i' THEN '  WITH INOUT
'
    WHEN 'b' THEN '  WITHOUT FUNCTION
'
  END ||
  CASE castcontext
    WHEN 'e' THEN '  AS EXPLICIT'
    WHEN 'a' THEN '  AS ASSIGNMENT'
    WHEN 'i' THEN '  AS IMPLICIT'
  END || ';' AS create_cast
FROM
  pg_cast c
  LEFT JOIN pg_proc p ON c.castfunc = p.oid
  LEFT JOIN pg_namespace n ON p.pronamespace = n.oid
WHERE
  (n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema') OR n.nspname IS NULL)
ORDER BY
  format_type(castsource, NULL), format_type(casttarget, NULL);

schema.title: Schema: constraints
schema.description: Shows ALTER TABLE statements for all table constraints in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
  'ALTER TABLE ' ||
  quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(t.relname) ||
  ' ADD CONSTRAINT ' || quote_ident(c.conname) || ' ' ||
  pg_get_constraintdef(c.oid) || ';' AS constraint_def
FROM
  pg_constraint c
  JOIN pg_class t ON c.conrelid = t.oid
  JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.relnamespace
WHERE
  n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema', 'pg_toast');

schema.title: Schema: triggers
schema.description: Shows CREATE TRIGGER statements for all triggers in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE TRIGGER ' || quote_ident(t.tgname) ||
    ' ' || pg_get_triggerdef(t.oid) || ';' AS create_trigger
FROM
    pg_trigger t
    JOIN pg_class c ON t.tgrelid = c.oid
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
WHERE
    NOT t.tgisinternal
    AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
ORDER BY
    n.nspname, c.relname, t.tgname;

schema.title: Schema: rules
schema.description: Shows CREATE RULE statements for all rules in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
    pg_get_ruledef(r.oid, true) || ';' AS create_rule
FROM
    pg_rewrite r
    JOIN pg_class c ON r.ev_class = c.oid
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
WHERE
    n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
    AND r.rulename <> '_RETURN'
ORDER BY
    n.nspname, c.relname, r.rulename;

schema.title: Schema: domains
schema.description: Shows CREATE DOMAIN statements for all domains in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE DOMAIN ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(t.typname) ||
    ' AS ' || pg_catalog.format_type(t.typbasetype, t.typtypmod) ||
    (CASE WHEN t.typnotnull THEN ' NOT NULL' ELSE '' END) ||
    (CASE WHEN t.typdefault IS NOT NULL THEN ' DEFAULT ' || t.typdefault ELSE '' END) ||
    (CASE WHEN c.oid IS NOT NULL THEN ' ' ||
        pg_catalog.pg_get_constraintdef(c.oid, true) ELSE '' END) || ';' AS create_domain
FROM
    pg_type t
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.typnamespace
    LEFT JOIN pg_constraint c ON c.contypid = t.oid
WHERE
    t.typtype = 'd' AND
    n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
ORDER BY
    n.nspname, t.typname;

schema.title: Schema: collations
schema.description: Shows CREATE COLLATION statements for all collations in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE COLLATION ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(c.collname) ||
    ' (LC_COLLATE = ' || quote_literal(c.collcollate) ||
    ', LC_CTYPE = ' || quote_literal(c.collctype) ||
    CASE
      WHEN c.collprovider = 'd' THEN ', PROVIDER = icu'
      ELSE ', PROVIDER = libc'
    END ||
    CASE
      WHEN c.collversion IS NOT NULL THEN ', VERSION = ' || quote_literal(c.collversion)
      ELSE ''
    END ||
    ');' AS create_collation
FROM
    pg_collation c
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.collnamespace
WHERE
    n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
ORDER BY
    n.nspname, c.collname;

schema.title: Schema: operators
schema.description: Shows CREATE OPERATOR statements for all operators in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE OPERATOR ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(o.oprname) ||
    ' (' ||
    'PROCEDURE = ' || (SELECT quote_ident(n2.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p.proname)
                       FROM pg_proc p
                       JOIN pg_namespace n2 ON p.pronamespace = n2.oid
                       WHERE p.oid = o.oprcode) ||
    CASE
      WHEN o.oprleft <> 0 THEN ', LEFTARG = ' || pg_catalog.format_type(o.oprleft, NULL)
      ELSE ''
    END ||
    CASE
      WHEN o.oprright <> 0 THEN ', RIGHTARG = ' || pg_catalog.format_type(o.oprright, NULL)
      ELSE ''
    END ||
    ');' AS create_operator
FROM
    pg_operator o
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON o.oprnamespace = n.oid
WHERE
    n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
ORDER BY
    n.nspname, o.oprname;

schema.title: Schema: text search configurations
schema.description: Shows CREATE TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION statements for all text search configurations in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(c.cfgname) ||
    ' (PARSER = ' || quote_ident(np.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p.prsname) || ');' AS create_ts_config
FROM
    pg_ts_config c
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.cfgnamespace = n.oid
    JOIN pg_ts_parser p ON c.cfgparser = p.oid
    JOIN pg_namespace np ON p.prsnamespace = np.oid
WHERE
    n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
ORDER BY
    n.nspname, c.cfgname;

schema.title: Schema: search configuration mappings
schema.description: Shows ALTER TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION statements for all text search configuration mappings in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'ALTER TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(c.cfgname) ||
    ' ADD MAPPING FOR ' || quote_ident(m.mapcfg::text) ||
    ' WITH ' || quote_ident(nd.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(d.dictname) || ';'
FROM
    (
        SELECT
            c.*,
            m.mapcfg,
            m.mapdict,
            row_number() OVER (PARTITION BY c.oid ORDER BY m.mapcfg) as rn
        FROM
            pg_ts_config c
            LEFT JOIN pg_ts_config_map m ON c.oid = m.mapcfg
    ) c
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.cfgnamespace = n.oid
    JOIN pg_ts_parser p ON c.cfgparser = p.oid
    JOIN pg_namespace np ON p.prsnamespace = np.oid
    LEFT JOIN pg_ts_dict d ON c.mapdict = d.oid
    LEFT JOIN pg_namespace nd ON d.dictnamespace = nd.oid
WHERE
    n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
ORDER BY
    n.nspname, c.cfgname;

schema.title: Schema: text search dictionaries
schema.description: Shows CREATE TEXT SEARCH DICTIONARY statements for all text search dictionaries in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE TEXT SEARCH DICTIONARY ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(d.dictname) ||
    ' (' ||
    'TEMPLATE = ' || quote_ident(nt.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(t.tmplname) ||
    CASE
      WHEN d.dictinitoption IS NOT NULL THEN ', ' || d.dictinitoption
      ELSE ''
    END ||
    ');' AS create_ts_dict
FROM
    pg_ts_dict d
    JOIN pg_ts_template t ON d.dicttemplate = t.oid
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON d.dictnamespace = n.oid
    JOIN pg_namespace nt ON t.tmplnamespace = nt.oid
WHERE
    n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
ORDER BY
    n.nspname, d.dictname;

schema.title: Schema: schemas
schema.description: Shows CREATE SCHEMA statements for all schemas in the database
schema.sql:
SELECT
  'CREATE SCHEMA ' || quote_ident(nspname) || ';
' ||
  CASE
    WHEN nspowner <> (SELECT oid FROM pg_roles WHERE rolname = CURRENT_USER)
    THEN 'ALTER SCHEMA ' || quote_ident(nspname) || ' OWNER TO ' || quote_ident(r.rolname) || ';'
    ELSE ''
  END AS create_schema
FROM
  pg_namespace n
  JOIN pg_roles r ON n.nspowner = r.oid
WHERE
  nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema', 'pg_toast')
  AND nspname NOT LIKE 'pg_%'
ORDER BY
  nspname;

schema.title: Schema: composite types
schema.description: Shows CREATE TYPE statements for composite types
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE TYPE ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(t.typname) ||
    ' AS (' ||
    string_agg(
        quote_ident(a.attname) || ' ' || format_type(a.atttypid, a.atttypmod),
        ', '
        ORDER BY a.attnum
    ) || ');' AS create_type
FROM
    pg_type t
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.typnamespace
    JOIN pg_class c ON c.oid = t.typrelid
    JOIN pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = c.oid
WHERE
    t.typtype = 'c'
    AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
    AND a.attnum > 0 AND NOT a.attisdropped
GROUP BY
    n.nspname, t.typname;

schema.title: Schema: enumerated types
schema.description: Shows CREATE TYPE statements for enumerated types
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE TYPE ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(t.typname) ||
    ' AS ENUM (' ||
    string_agg(quote_literal(e.enumlabel), ', ' ORDER BY e.enumsortorder) ||
    ');' AS create_enum
FROM
    pg_type t
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.typnamespace
    JOIN pg_enum e ON t.oid = e.enumtypid
WHERE
    t.typtype = 'e'
    AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
GROUP BY
    n.nspname, t.typname;

schema.title: Schema: materialized views
schema.description: Shows CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(c.relname) ||
    ' AS ' || pg_get_viewdef(c.oid, true) ||
    ';' AS create_mat_view
FROM
    pg_class c
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
WHERE
    c.relkind = 'm'
    AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema');

schema.title: Schema: text search parsers
schema.description: Shows CREATE TEXT SEARCH PARSER statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
  'CREATE TEXT SEARCH PARSER ' ||
  quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p.prsname) || ' (' ||
  'START = ' || quote_ident(ns.nspname) || '.' || p.prsstart::text || ', ' ||
  'GETTOKEN = ' || quote_ident(ng.nspname) || '.' || p.prstoken::text || ', ' ||
  'END = ' || quote_ident(ne.nspname) || '.' || p.prsend::text || ', ' ||
  'LEXTYPES = ' || quote_ident(nl.nspname) || '.' || p.prslextype::text ||
  CASE
    WHEN p.prsheadline IS NOT NULL THEN ', HEADLINE = ' || quote_ident(nh.nspname) || '.' || p.prsheadline::text
    ELSE ''
  END || ');' AS create_ts_parser
FROM
  pg_ts_parser p
  JOIN pg_namespace n ON p.prsnamespace = n.oid
  JOIN pg_proc ps ON p.prsstart = ps.oid
  JOIN pg_namespace ns ON ps.pronamespace = ns.oid
  JOIN pg_proc pg ON p.prstoken = pg.oid
  JOIN pg_namespace ng ON pg.pronamespace = ng.oid
  JOIN pg_proc pe ON p.prsend = pe.oid
  JOIN pg_namespace ne ON pe.pronamespace = ne.oid
  JOIN pg_proc pl ON p.prslextype = pl.oid
  JOIN pg_namespace nl ON pl.pronamespace = nl.oid
  LEFT JOIN pg_proc ph ON p.prsheadline = ph.oid
  LEFT JOIN pg_namespace nh ON ph.pronamespace = nh.oid
WHERE
  n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema');

schema.title: Schema: text search templates
schema.description: Shows CREATE TEXT SEARCH TEMPLATE statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
  'CREATE TEXT SEARCH TEMPLATE ' ||
  quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p.tmplname) || ' (' ||
  CASE
    WHEN p.tmplinit::text IS NOT NULL THEN 'INIT = ' || quote_ident(ni.nspname) || '.' || p.tmplinit::text || ', '
    ELSE ''
  END ||
  'LEXIZE = ' || quote_ident(nl.nspname) || '.' || p.tmpllexize::text || ');' AS create_ts_template
FROM
  pg_ts_template p
  JOIN pg_namespace n ON p.tmplnamespace = n.oid
  JOIN pg_proc pl ON p.tmpllexize = pl.oid
  JOIN pg_namespace nl ON pl.pronamespace = nl.oid
  LEFT JOIN pg_proc pi ON p.tmplinit = pi.oid
  LEFT JOIN pg_namespace ni ON pi.pronamespace = ni.oid
WHERE
  n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema');

schema.title: Schema: text search dictionaries
schema.description: Shows CREATE TEXT SEARCH DICTIONARY statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
  'CREATE TEXT SEARCH DICTIONARY ' ||
  quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(d.dictname) || ' (' ||
  'TEMPLATE = ' || quote_ident(nt.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(t.tmplname) ||
  CASE
    WHEN d.dictinitoption IS NOT NULL THEN ', ' || d.dictinitoption
    ELSE ''
  END || ');' AS create_ts_dictionary
FROM
  pg_ts_dict d
  JOIN pg_ts_template t ON d.dicttemplate = t.oid
  JOIN pg_namespace n ON d.dictnamespace = n.oid
  JOIN pg_namespace nt ON t.tmplnamespace = nt.oid
WHERE
  n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema');

schema.title: Schema: text search configurations
schema.description: Shows CREATE TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
  string_agg(
    CASE
      WHEN rn = 1 THEN
        'CREATE TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION ' ||
        quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(c.cfgname) || ' (' ||
        'PARSER = ' || quote_ident(np.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(p.prsname) ||
        ');'
      ELSE
        'ALTER TEXT SEARCH CONFIGURATION ' ||
        quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(c.cfgname) ||
        ' ADD MAPPING FOR ' || quote_ident(m.mapcfg::text) ||
        ' WITH ' || quote_ident(nd.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(d.dictname) || ';'
    END,
    E'\n'
  ) AS create_ts_config
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      c.*,
      m.mapcfg,
      m.mapdict,
      row_number() OVER (PARTITION BY c.oid ORDER BY m.mapcfg) as rn
    FROM
      pg_ts_config c
      LEFT JOIN pg_ts_config_map m ON c.oid = m.mapcfg
  ) c
  JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.cfgnamespace = n.oid
  JOIN pg_ts_parser p ON c.cfgparser = p.oid
  JOIN pg_namespace np ON p.prsnamespace = np.oid
  LEFT JOIN pg_ts_dict d ON c.mapdict = d.oid
  LEFT JOIN pg_namespace nd ON d.dictnamespace = nd.oid
WHERE
  n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
GROUP BY
  n.nspname,
  c.cfgname,
  np.nspname,
  p.prsname

schema.title: Schema: foreign data wrappers
schema.description: Shows CREATE FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER ' || quote_ident(fdw.fdwname) ||
    CASE
      WHEN fdw.fdwhandler <> 0 THEN ' HANDLER ' || pg_get_function_identity_arguments(fdw.fdwhandler)
      ELSE ''
    END ||
    CASE
      WHEN fdw.fdwvalidator <> 0 THEN ' VALIDATOR ' || pg_get_function_identity_arguments(fdw.fdwvalidator)
      ELSE ''
    END || ';' AS create_fdw
FROM
    pg_foreign_data_wrapper fdw
WHERE
    fdw.fdwname NOT IN ('postgres_fdw', 'file_fdw');

schema.title: Schema: foreign servers
schema.description: Shows CREATE SERVER statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE SERVER ' || quote_ident(srv.srvname) ||
    ' FOREIGN DATA WRAPPER ' || quote_ident(fdw.fdwname) ||
    CASE
      WHEN srv.srvtype IS NOT NULL THEN ' TYPE ' || quote_literal(srv.srvtype)
      ELSE ''
    END ||
    CASE
      WHEN srv.srvversion IS NOT NULL THEN ' VERSION ' || quote_literal(srv.srvversion)
      ELSE ''
    END ||
    (CASE
      WHEN srv.srvoptions IS NOT NULL THEN ' OPTIONS (' || array_to_string(srv.srvoptions, ', ') || ')'
      ELSE ''
    END) || ';' AS create_server
FROM
    pg_foreign_server srv
    JOIN pg_foreign_data_wrapper fdw ON srv.srvfdw = fdw.oid;

schema.title: Schema: user mappings
schema.description: Shows CREATE USER MAPPING statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE USER MAPPING FOR ' || quote_ident(um.usename) ||
    ' SERVER ' || quote_ident(srv.srvname) ||
    (CASE
      WHEN um.umoptions IS NOT NULL THEN ' OPTIONS (' || array_to_string(um.umoptions, ', ') || ')'
      ELSE ''
    END) || ';' AS create_user_mapping
FROM
    pg_user_mappings um
    JOIN pg_foreign_server srv ON um.srvid = srv.oid;

schema.title: Schema: row level security policies
schema.description: Shows CREATE POLICY statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE POLICY ' || quote_ident(pol.polname) ||
    ' ON ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(c.relname) ||
    CASE
      WHEN pol.polcmd::text != '*' THEN ' FOR ' || pol.polcmd::text
      ELSE ''
    END ||
    CASE
      WHEN pol.polroles <> '{0}' THEN
        ' TO ' || array_to_string(array(
          SELECT quote_ident(rolname)
          FROM pg_roles
          WHERE oid = ANY(pol.polroles)
        ), ', ')
      ELSE ''
    END ||
    CASE
      WHEN pol.polqual IS NOT NULL THEN ' USING (' || pg_get_expr(pol.polqual, pol.polrelid) || ')'
      ELSE ''
    END ||
    CASE
      WHEN pol.polwithcheck IS NOT NULL THEN ' WITH CHECK (' || pg_get_expr(pol.polwithcheck, pol.polrelid) || ')'
      ELSE ''
    END || ';' AS create_policy
FROM
    pg_policy pol
    JOIN pg_class c ON pol.polrelid = c.oid
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
WHERE
    n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema');

schema.title: Schema: publications
schema.description: Shows CREATE PUBLICATION statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE PUBLICATION ' || quote_ident(pub.pubname) ||
    CASE
      WHEN pub.puballtables THEN ' FOR ALL TABLES'
      ELSE ' FOR TABLE ' || string_agg(quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(c.relname), ', ')
    END || ';' AS create_publication
FROM
    pg_publication pub
    LEFT JOIN pg_publication_rel pr ON pub.oid = pr.prpubid
    LEFT JOIN pg_class c ON pr.prrelid = c.oid
    LEFT JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
GROUP BY
    pub.pubname,
    pub.puballtables;

schema.title: Schema: extensions
schema.description: Shows CREATE EXTENSION statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS ' || quote_ident(ext.extname) ||
    ' WITH SCHEMA ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) ||
    CASE
      WHEN ext.extversion IS NOT NULL THEN ' VERSION ' || quote_literal(ext.extversion)
      ELSE ''
    END || ';' AS create_extension
FROM
    pg_extension ext
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON ext.extnamespace = n.oid
WHERE
    ext.extname NOT IN ('plpgsql');

schema.title: Schema: statistics
schema.description: Shows CREATE STATISTICS statements
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'CREATE STATISTICS ' || quote_ident(s.stxname) ||
    ' (' || array_to_string(ARRAY(
        SELECT
            CASE
                WHEN stxkind[i] = 'd' THEN 'NDISTINCT'
                WHEN stxkind[i] = 'f' THEN 'DEPENDENCIES'
                WHEN stxkind[i] = 'm' THEN 'MCV'
            END
        FROM generate_subscripts(s.stxkind, 1) as i
    ), ', ') || ')' ||
    ' ON ' || array_to_string(ARRAY_AGG(quote_ident(a.attname)), ', ') ||
    ' FROM ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(c.relname) || ';' AS create_statistics
FROM
    pg_statistic_ext s
    JOIN pg_class c ON s.stxrelid = c.oid
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
    JOIN pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY(s.stxkeys)
WHERE
    n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
GROUP BY
    s.stxname,
    s.stxkind,
    n.nspname,
    c.relname;

schema.title: Schema: comments
schema.description: Shows COMMENT ON statements for tables, views, and materialized views
schema.sql:
SELECT
    'COMMENT ON TABLE ' || quote_ident(n.nspname) || '.' || quote_ident(c.relname) ||
    ' IS ' || quote_literal(obj_description(c.oid, 'pg_class')) || ';' AS comment_table
FROM
    pg_class c
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON c.relnamespace = n.oid
WHERE
    c.relkind IN ('r', 'v', 'm')
    AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema')
    AND obj_description(c.oid, 'pg_class') IS NOT NULL;
